X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Our launch script (bin/heritrix) builds its own CLASSPATH so any 
attempts to set an alternate CLASSPATH before running our script may not 
have the intended effect. It automatically builds a CLASSPATH containing 
every JAR it finds in the 'lib' directory -- you may want to try 
dropping your other JAR there.

But, it's impossible to tell for sure what's happening in your situation 
without seeing the errors.

- Gordon @ IA

lpeterus wrote:
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "lpeterus" <lpeterus@...> wrote:
>> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@> wrote:
>>> lpeterus wrote:
>>>> Hi!
>>>>
>>>> I made a processor for inserting content information into a mysql
>>>> database. I included the name in processor.options and placed the
>>>> .java file into the writer folder in the source. Then built heritrix
>>>> using Maven. The new processor does show up on the webUI but the
>>>> processor doesn't work correctly when I do a crawl. I get toethread
>>>> errors, am I doing this wrong? Thanks.
>>> Without knowing the error, it's impossible to tell. If it's not 
>>> something like 'class not found', and the crawl launched before the 
>>> error occurred, it's probably a bug in your code.
>>>
>>> - Gordon @ IA
>>>
>> I actually modified the code seen in this article. I'm not sure if its
>> not up to date with heritrix 1.14 or something I changed. For the most
>> part I just altered it to accept xml rather than html and got rid of
>> the strip tag function and where it was used. 
>> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/4538
>>
> 
> Ok, I believe its not recognizing the driver. I'm using the mysql
> supported JDBC driver thats wrapped in a jar file. Its manual says to
> add the path to jar file into CLASSPATH like this:
> export set CLASSPATH=/path/mysql-connector-java-[ver]-bin.jar:$CLASSPATH
> Since I don't have admin rights on the system, I'm using the Java
> thats extracted/installed in my home directory. When I run a script to
> use the driver after exporting, it sees the driver and works. When I
> use it in heritrix, it doesn't work because the errors get caught by
> exceptions. 
> Is it possible that adding it to CLASSPATH doesn't allow the Java
> program (which I set JAVA_HOME to when running Heritrix) to see where
> the driver is?
> 
> 
>
